readability_reflection: The concatenation with interpolation was easier to read. Variable names are more recognizable and its easier to tell when the quotation of the string ends and starts.
comprehension_debugging: No, neither affected my ability to debug them. There is a question though that the answers is written incorrectly which is the John Doe question.
preference_rationale: I would choose interpolation. Its easier to tell where the injections occur and what is in the string print out vs what isn't.
learning_curve: My time writing powershell is likely the reason I prefer interpolation, its comfortable and something I work with regularly.
suggestions_improvement: Use as little quotation marks as soon as possible.
